author: iarspider
body:
Also, replace `optparser` with `argparse` (notice: requires python 2.7 or 3.2+). We should also check if files marked with "Is this file used" are used or not.

Notable changes:
* I couldn't find any references to `ActionError` in Python documentation
* `runCmd` (i.e. [`subprocess.getstatusoutput`](https://docs.python.org/3/library/subprocess.html) ) does not throw any exceptions, even if the command fails, so surrounding it in `try..catch` is useless

@smuzaffar I'd like to get this done first, this will help with the removal of ignominy. Question: do we want to maintain compatibility with Python2? If so, with which versions of Python 2?
title: [WIP] Make Python scripts conform to PEP-8
